intro: Rochea biconvexa, commonly known as the two-convex rock cress, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbages. The plant is characterized by its small, bright yellow flowers and fleshy, succulent leaves. It typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Rochea biconvexa is often found in mountainous regions, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
